com.payu.ratel.tests

Class RatelTestContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.payu.ratel.tests.RatelTestContext

  • public class RatelTestContext
extends Object
    A context that is bound to a test with ratel-testing capabilities. It enables you to control the process of registering/unregistering the services during test execution.
    See Also:
    RatelTest

    • Method Detail

      • getServiceDiscoveryPort

        public static int getServiceDiscoveryPort()

      • startService

        public org.springframework.context.ConfigurableApplicationContext startService(Class springJavaConfigClass)
        Starts a new, separate spring context with a given configuration. The started services have separate http port and are configured to use an in-memory test registry server. If you start multiple services this way, they will act as a separate applications, but will be registered in a single registry service.
        Parameters:
        springJavaConfigClass - the configuration to start. If you want to start multiple configurations in a single context, group them together in a single java config and pass in this parameter
        Returns:
        the started context. You can close, restart or stop it during the test.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes all spring contexts that were created in.

      • waitForServicesRegistration

        public void waitForServicesRegistration(int numberOfServices)
        Wait until a test registry server bound to this context registers a given number of active service instances.
        Parameters:
        numberOfServices - the expected number of services
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if the number was not reached within configured timeout

      • waitForServiceRegistration

        public void waitForServiceRegistration(Class<?>... serviceInterfaces)
        Wait until a test registry server bound to this context registers services of all specified interfaces. When this method returns successfully, it is guaranteed that all given services are up and running.
        Parameters:
        serviceInterfaces - - array of expected service interfaces.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if at least one service was not registered within configured timeout

      • waitForServicesRegistration

        public void waitForServicesRegistration()
        Wait until all services necessary for this test are up and running and registered in the test registry server. The context assumes all contexts given in RatelTest.registerServices() and explicitly added by addObservedContext(ApplicationContext) to be service producers. Therefore this method will not finalize until all services published by the above contexts are available in the test registry server.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if at least one of the services provided by relevant application contexts is not available in the service registry within the configured timeout.

      • hasService

        public boolean hasService(Class<?> serviceClass)
        Verifies if a test registry server bound to this context has registered at least one instance of a service with a given contract.
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - the service interface to check.
        Returns:
        true iff the service is available

      • addObservedContext

        public void addObservedContext(org.springframework.context.ApplicationContext applicationContext)
        Register a given context so that all Ratel services produced by it will be observed by this RatelTestContext. If you invoke a method waitForServicesRegistration(), the services from this context will also be considered and the method will not finalize until all services punlished by it are up and running.
        Parameters:
        applicationContext - the context to add
